What is What should I see??

Tell me details on Main attractions.
Can you tell me about Main attractions?
responses: Sri Lanka's treasures include: Sigiriya Rock Fortress, Temple of the Tooth Relic (Kandy), Galle Fort, Yala National Park, Adam's Peak, Nuwara Eliya tea country, Anuradhapura ancient city, and Mirissa beaches.
Must-visit sites: Cultural Triangle sites, Ella's Nine Arch Bridge, Udawalawe Elephant Sanctuary, Polonnaruwa ruins, and Bentota beaches.

patterns: What should I know about traditions?
What do you know about Dress code advice?
Can you tell me about Dress code advice?
What do you know about Local customs?
Can you tell me about What should I know about traditions??
I want to know about What should I know about traditions?.
Could you explain What should I know about traditions??
What do you know about Cultural norms?
Can you tell me about Cultural norms?
responses: When visiting temples: Cover shoulders/knees, remove shoes/hats. Avoid touching Buddha statues. Receive items with right hand. Always ask permission before taking photos of people.
Sri Lankans appreciate modest dress. Nudity is illegal. Public displays of affection frowned upon. Remove shoes in homes.

patterns: Give me info about When to visit?.

Can you tell me about Best season?
Tell me details on Weather conditions.
I want to know about Monsoon season.
Can you tell me about Dry season months?
Could you explain Dry season months?
Any facts about Dry season months?
responses: West/South coasts best Dec-Apr. East coast best May-Sep. Hill Country good year-round. Yala monsoon May-Aug, Maha monsoon Oct-Jan.
Ideal time: January to April for beaches. July-August for festivals. November for wildlife watching.

patterns: Give me info about Local foods to try.

I want to know about Famous cuisine.
Any facts about What's the national dish??
What do you know about What's the national dish??
Could you explain What's the national dish??
responses: Must-try: Rice & curry, hoppers (appa), kottu roti, string hoppers, lamprais, pol sambol. Desserts: wattalappam, kalu dodol. Drink: Ceylon tea, king coconut water!
Sri Lankan specialties: Jaffna crab curry, ambul thiyal (sour fish), wood apple juice. Street food: isso wade (shrimp fritters), rotti.

I want to know about Tuk-tuk fares.
What do you know about Tuk-tuk fares?
responses: Options: trains (scenic routes), buses (cheap but crowded), private drivers (₹5000-8000/day). Tuk-tuks for short trips - negotiate first! Train recommended for Colombo-Kandy-Ella route.
Use PickMe app for taxis. Trains best booked in advance. Domestic flights available to Jaffna/Batticaloa.

Can you tell me about Birdwatching spots?
responses: Yala (leopards), Udawalawe (elephants), Minneriya (The Gathering), Sinharaja (birds), Wilpattu (sloth bears). Best safaris at dawn.
Top wildlife: Udawalawe Elephant Transit Home, Kumana Bird Sanctuary, Gal Oya National Park boat safaris.

Unique stays: Tea estate bungalows, rainforest eco-villas, converted Dutch warehouses in Galle Fort.

responses: Key festivals: Esala Perahera (July/Aug - Kandy), Sinhala New Year (April), Vesak (May), Deepavali (Oct/Nov), Christmas (Coastal areas).
Don't miss: Kandy Perahera's elephant procession, Jaffna Nallur Festival, Dondra Perahera.

responses: Top treks: Adam's Peak pilgrimage (Dec-May), Knuckles Range, Ella Rock, Horton Plains to World's End, Sinharaja Rainforest trails.
Hiking essentials: Start early, carry water, wear layers. Guides recommended for Knuckles/Mountain regions.

responses: West: Bentota (family), Hikkaduwa (diving). East: Arugam Bay (surfing), Pasikuda (calm waters). South: Mirissa (whale watching), Tangalle (secluded).
Top beach activities: Whale watching (Mirissa), snorkeling (Pigeon Island), surfing (Midigama), turtle watching (Rekawa).

responses: 8 UNESCO Sites: Sigiriya, Polonnaruwa, Anuradhapura, Galle Fort, Sinharaja Forest, Kandy Sacred City, Dambulla Cave Temple, Central Highlands.
History trail: Anuradhapura's sacred Bodhi tree, Polonnaruwa's stone temples, Jaffna Fort, Colombo National Museum.

Can you tell me about Visa on arrival?
What do you know about Visa on arrival?
Give me info about How to get visa?.
Can you tell me about How to get visa??
responses: Most need Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) - apply online 3 days before. 30-day tourist visa ≈ $50. Extensions possible at Immigration Dept.
Check eta.gov.lk. Requirements: Passport valid 6mo, return ticket, sufficient funds. Visa-free for some countries.

patterns: What is Is Sri Lanka safe??
Tell me details on Is Sri Lanka safe?.
Can you tell me about Is Sri Lanka safe??
Can you tell me about Travel warnings?
Tell me details on Health precautions.
What do you know about Emergency numbers?
Give me info about Vaccinations needed.
What do you know about Vaccinations needed?
responses: Generally safe. Avoid political gatherings. Use registered taxis. Emergency: 119 (police), 110 (ambulance). Recommended vaccines: Hep A, Typhoid.
Health: Drink bottled water, use mosquito repellent. Beware strong currents at beaches. Keep valuables secure.

Give me info about Best shopping areas.
responses: Popular items: Ceylon tea, spices, handloom textiles, wooden masks, silver jewelry, batik clothing, lacquerware. Visit: Pettah Market, Laksala Govt. stores.
Best buys: Dilmah tea, blue sapphires (certified), Ayurveda products, traditional drums. Bargain in markets!

responses: Sinhala: Ayubowan (hello), Istuti (thank you). Tamil: Vanakkam (hello), Nandri (thanks). English widely spoken in tourist areas.
Helpful phrases: 'Kohomada?' (How are you?), 'Mehe kiyada?' (How much?), 'Mata therumak nehe' (I don't understand).

Any facts about First-time visit plan?
responses: Classic 10-day route: Colombo → Sigiriya → Kandy → Nuwara Eliya → Ella → Yala → Galle → Departure. Adjust for beaches/wildlife focus.
1 week: Cultural Triangle (3d), Hill Country (2d), South Coast (2d). 2 weeks: Add East Coast & Jaffna.

responses: Adventure options: Kitulgala white-water rafting, Belihul Oya abseiling, Kandy to Ella bike trail, Arugam Bay kitesurfing, Knuckles Range mountain trekking.
Try: Diving at Great Basses Reef, surfing at Weligama, hot air ballooning in Dambulla, zip-lining in Sinharaja Rainforest.

responses: Central: Tea plantations, Horton Plains, Adam's Peak. Eastern: Trinco beaches, Batticaloa lagoon. Northern: Jaffna culture, Nainativu Island. Southern: Galle architecture, Mirissa whales.
Provincial specialties: Sabaragamuwa (gem mines), North Central (ancient cities), Western (Colombo nightlife)

Can you tell me about Backpacking Sri Lanka?
Give me info about Backpacking Sri Lanka.
responses: Budget tips: Use local buses (₹50-300), eat at kades (local eateries ₹200-500), stay in guesthouses (₹1500-3000/night), visit free temples.
Free attractions: Gangaramaya Temple, Galle Fort walls, Jaffna Public Library, Kandy Lake, Colombo Lotus Tower observation deck.

Child-safe: Brief Garden (Bentota), Turtle Hatcheries (Kosgoda), Spice Gardens (Matale), Railway Museum (Kadugannawa)

responses: Nightlife hotspots: Colombo's Park Street Mews, Galle Face Hotel Verandah, Unawatuna Beach parties, Hikkaduwa reggae bars. Casino: Bally's in Colombo.
Cultural nights: Kandy Dance Shows, Galle Fort jazz nights, Negombo seafood dinners with fire dances.

Sustainable experiences: Village walks in Dambana (Vedda community), mangrove planting in Puttalam, ethical elephant encounters at Millennium Elephant Foundation.

Pilgrimage route: Adam's Peak → Sri Pada → Muthiyangana Raja Maha Viharaya → Kataragama

Specialized tours: Ayurveda Retreats (Beruwela), Photography Safaris (Yala), Tea Trail Walks (Nuwara Eliya)

responses: Top photo ops: Nine Arch Bridge (Ella), Little Adam's Peak sunrise, St. Clair's Falls, Jaffna Dutch Fort silhouette, Mirissa Fishermen on stilts.
Drone rules: Need Civil Aviation Authority permit. Banned near military sites. Max altitude 400ft.

responses: Wellness centers: Siddhalepa Ayurveda Resort, Barberyn Reef Ayurveda, Santani Wellness Resort, Sen Wellness Sanctuary.
Yoga/Meditation: Parampara (Unawatuna), Nilaveli Beach yoga, Knuckles Mountain retreats, Buddhist temple meditation programs.

responses: Key trains: Colombo-Kandy-Ella (7h), Coastal Line (Colombo-Matara 3h). Check railways.gov.lk. Expressway toll: Colombo-Katunayake ₹800.
Car hire: Need valid IDP. Rates from ₹4000/day. Helitours flights: Colombo-Jaffna (1h, ₹15k)
